{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/title|max_exponent10}}
{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++11
|dcl1=
static const int max_exponent10;
|dcl2=
static constexpr int max_exponent10;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::max_exponent10}} is the largest positive number {{c|n}} such that {{mathjax-or|\(\scriptsize 10^n\)|10{{su|p=n}}}} is a representable finite value of the floating-point type {{tt|T}}.

===Example===
{{example
|Demonstrates the relationships of {{lc|max_exponent}}, {{tt|max_exponent10}}, and {{lc|max()}} for the type {{c/core|float}}:
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;limits&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "max() = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::max() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "max_exponent10 = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::max_exponent10 &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; std::hexfloat &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "max() = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::max() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "max_exponent = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::max_exponent &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
max() = 3.40282e+38
max_exponent10 = 38

max() = 0x1.fffffep+127
max_exponent = 128
}}
